intro: Hieracium euglossoides, commonly known as the golden hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its yellowish-orange flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the leaves are generally rough and hairy. Hieracium euglossoides is often found in open habitats and is considered a common weed in some regions.
